page.title: 02Old People's Memories
page.content: Old people's memories of World War 2. We went to the hospital to ask old people what they did during the war. One person said that he was a truck driver carrying weapons.I asked what it was like on V.E.Day.He said people were dancing,street lights were switched on and everybody was eating and drinking. Another person had been in the jungle and was still fighting when the European war ended;he was nearly killed by a bomb. One man was just a school boy.An old lady had driven an ambulance.She said if you had a spare room in your house it mustn't be left empty,you had to let someone live there.Another old lady came to our school during the war and helped to fill sandbags before the school term started in 1939. Barry Scanlon.
